intro: Ixeridium kurilense, commonly known as the Kuril sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to the northern Pacific coastal regions, including parts of Russia, Japan, and the United States, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
